definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: The biggest frameless cabinetry manufacturer in north America. The choice of the world's richest man.
sentences.chinese: 北美最顶尖的现代橱柜品牌，世界首富的选择。

sentences.english: Claiming the nation's richest man among their number is a source of considerable pride for America's society of southpaws.
sentences.chinese: 包括美国第一首富在内，是美国左撇子最引以为豪的。

sentences.english: Huang Guangyu, who founded Gome Electrical Appliances and owns unlisted property businesses, sank to 17th place from the top position he held last year.
sentences.chinese: 成立国美电器的黄光裕，已从首富跌至17名。

sentences.english: Cina's richest man is set to join the ruling Communist Party's Central Committee, media reports say.
sentences.chinese: 据媒体报道，中国首富将要进入中共中央委员会。

sentences.english: He put on a dinner jacket to serve as a waiter at the birthday party of The Richest Man in America.
sentences.chinese: 他穿上餐服准备到美国首富的生日聚会上去担任侍者。

sentences.english: India's richest man may have bitten off more than he can chew.
sentences.chinese: 印度首富可能有咬掉超过他贪多嚼不烂。

sentences.english: Xanatos was the son of Crion, the wealthiest man on the planet Telos.
sentences.chinese: 扎纳托斯是特洛斯星球首富克里昂的儿子。

sentences.english: Mr. Huang, once China's richest man, is known for rocking the boat.
sentences.chinese: 曾一度是中国首富的黄光裕是出了名的不安分人物。

sentences.english: He used to top the list of China's richest.
Buffett achieved with his life, the world's richest man, together with the world's biggest donator.
sentences.chinese: 巴菲特用一生实现了，世界首富的聚与世界首捐的散。

sentences.english: The electricals retailer was founded by Huang Guangyu, an entrepreneur who was once China's richest man.
sentences.chinese: 这家电器零售商由黄光裕创立，他曾经是中国首富。

sentences.english: My favorite fantasy is that I win the lottery and become the richest person in the world.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢幻想的是卖彩票中大奖成为全球首富。

sentences.english: But if the selection of the world's "richest man, " it is none other than the non-Harvard.
sentences.chinese: 但如果评选世界大学中的“首富”，那非哈佛莫属。

definition: Monopoly (game)/known as 大富翁[Da4 fu4 weng1] in PRC
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
Sir Li Ka-shing (1928-), Hong Kong businessman
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
big shot (leading some field or group)/godfather
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
